revised_title: Fossil Plants of the Coal-measures: Anatomical Discoveries and Theories
tldr: The author, Dr. W. C. Williamson, conducted extensive research on fossil plants from the Coal-measures, focusing on their anatomy and growth patterns. He discovered the life-history of a plant from Burntisland, including its vascular system and the differentiation of its cortical portion. Williamson also found specimens of Diploxylon, Lomatophloios, and Dictyoxylon (now known as Lyginodendron), providing evidence for their classification and evolution. This research contributed significantly to the understanding of paleophytology and the study of ancient plant life.
